Torchbox

Oxford Geek Nights #21

| 7:30pm

Keynotes

Keynote speakers are invited to talk at Oxford Geek Nights. OGN21 will feature:

  • Styleguides for the Web, by Paul Lloyd, visual designer at Clearleft (slides)
  • Rapid prototyping: fast, continuous, informed design and development, by Eewei Chen and Nick Bailey, Experience Design at Thoughtworks (slides)

Microslots

Microslots are five-minute "lightning talks" that anyone can volunteer for. They consist of around five to ten slides and the audience is generally friendly and interested!

Confirmed microslots for OGN21 are:

  • MacGyverism and Mobile Testing Rigs, by John Sulaitis (slides)
  • Why Open Source Hardware matters, by Paul Downey (slides)
  • HTML5 Canvas, by Paul King (slides)
  • OpenStreetMap: Operation 'Complete Oxfordshire', by Richard Fairhurst (slides)

Want to volunteer a microslot for OGN21? Submit your idea here and we'll see you on the night!

Join the mailing list

Oxford Geek Night is a regular meet-up for designers & developers run by Torchbox

We have two keynote talks of 15 minutes each followed by a handful of 5 minute micro-slots.
